description: The hwAddRateLimitAclTrap will be sent when the rate limit acl is added.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwAddRateLimitAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitDirection i 0

description: The delivery entry index of an ACL rule used for traffic limitation is a delivery record entry index used by software,
which is meaningless to users. The index is used in hwRateLimitTable to search the delivery entries fast.
Range: 0-2999
In the create operation, the device automatically allocates a delivery entry index.
There is a suggestion that users can always input 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitAclIndex

description: Specifies the index of a port or a slot for traffic limitation.
It uniquely identifies a port or a slot.
The value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
If the configuration based on a slot, the bits map is shown as follows:
| 31-25 bits | 24-19 bits | 18-13 bits | 12-6 bits | 5-0 bits is reserved |
| indicate iftype | indicate frame ID | indicate slot ID | indicate port ID | |
| the value of iftype | frame ID | slot ID | the value of port ID | the reserved value |
| is always 0x68 | | | is always 0 | is always 0 |
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ACL rule used for traffic limitation takes effect.
Currently, only the inbound direction is supported.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port or a slot
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port or a slot
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitDirection

description: The hwDeleteRateLimitAclTrap will be sent when the rate limit acl is deleted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwDeleteRateLimitAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitDirection i 0

description: The delivery entry index of an ACL rule used for traffic limitation is a delivery record entry index used by software,
which is meaningless to users. The index is used in hwRateLimitTable to search the delivery entries fast.
Range: 0-2999
In the create operation, the device automatically allocates a delivery entry index.
There is a suggestion that users can always input 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitAclIndex

description: Specifies the index of a port or a slot for traffic limitation.
It uniquely identifies a port or a slot.
The value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
If the configuration based on a slot, the bits map is shown as follows:
| 31-25 bits | 24-19 bits | 18-13 bits | 12-6 bits | 5-0 bits is reserved |
| indicate iftype | indicate frame ID | indicate slot ID | indicate port ID | |
| the value of iftype | frame ID | slot ID | the value of port ID | the reserved value |
| is always 0x68 | | | is always 0 | is always 0 |
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ACL rule used for traffic limitation takes effect.
Currently, only the inbound direction is supported.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port or a slot
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port or a slot
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRateLimitDirection

description: The hwAddPriorityAclTrap will be sent when the priority acl is added.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwAddPriorityAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityDirection i 0

description: Indicates the delivery entry index of an ACL rule for priority marking.
It is a delivery record entry index used by software, which is meaningless to users.
The index is used in hwPriorityTable to search the delivery entries fast.
Range: 0-2999
In the create operation, the device automatically allocates a delivery entry index.
There is a suggestion that users can always input 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityAclIndex

description: Indicates the port index or the slot index when the device delivers an ACL rule for priority marking to a specified port or a specified slot.
The index uniquely identifies a port or a slot. The value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
If the configuration based on a slot, the bits map is shown as follows:
| 31-25 bits | 24-19 bits | 18-13 bits | 12-6 bits | 5-0 bits is reserved |
| indicate iftype | indicate frame ID | indicate slot ID | indicate port ID | |
| the value of iftype | frame ID | slot ID | the value of port ID | the reserved value |
| is always 0x68 | | | is always 0 | is always 0 |
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ALC rule for priority marking
takes effect when the device delivers an ACL rule to a specified port or a specified slot.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter.
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port or a slot.
It is used to configure the priority for the packets
that are received on a specified port or a slot.
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port or a slot.
It is used to configure the priority for the packets
that are transmitted on a specified port or a slot.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityDirection

description: The hwDeletePriorityAclTrap will be sent when the priority acl is deleted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwDeletePriorityAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityDirection i 0

variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityAclIndex

description: Indicates the port index or the slot index when the device delivers an ACL rule for priority marking to a specified port or a specified slot.
The index uniquely identifies a port or a slot. The value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
If the configuration based on a slot, the bits map is shown as follows:
| 31-25 bits | 24-19 bits | 18-13 bits | 12-6 bits | 5-0 bits is reserved |
| indicate iftype | indicate frame ID | indicate slot ID | indicate port ID | |
| the value of iftype | frame ID | slot ID | the value of port ID | the reserved value |
| is always 0x68 | | | is always 0 | is always 0 |
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ALC rule for priority marking
takes effect when the device delivers an ACL rule to a specified port or a specified slot.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter.
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port or a slot.
It is used to configure the priority for the packets
that are received on a specified port or a slot.
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port or a slot.
It is used to configure the priority for the packets
that are transmitted on a specified port or a slot.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwPriorityDirection

description: The hwAddRedirectAclTrap will be sent when the redirect acl is added.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwAddRedirectAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectDirection i 0

description: The delivery entry index of an ACL rule for redirecting packets is a delivery
record entry index used by software, which is meaningless to users.
The index is used in hwRedirectTable to search the delivery entries fast.
Range: 0-2999
In the create operation, the device automatically allocates a delivery entry index.
There is a suggestion that users can always input 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectAclIndex

description: Indicates the port index when the device delivers an ACL rule for redirecting
packets to a specified port. The index uniquely identifies a port.
The value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ACL rule for redirecting packets takes
effect when the device delivers an ACL rule to a specified port.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter.
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port.
It is used for redirecting the packets received on a port.
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port.
It is used for redirecting the packets transmitted on a port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectDirection

description: The hwDeleteRedirectAclTrap will be sent when the redirect acl is deleted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwDeleteRedirectAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectDirection i 0

variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectAclIndex

variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ACL rule for redirecting packets takes
effect when the device delivers an ACL rule to a specified port.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter.
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port.
It is used for redirecting the packets received on a port.
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port.
It is used for redirecting the packets transmitted on a port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwRedirectDirection

description: The hwAddStatisticAclTrap will be sent when the statistic acl added.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwAddStatisticAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticDirection i 0

2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port.

3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port.
It is used for measuring the traffic measurement transmitted on a specified port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticDirection

description: The hwDeleteStatisticAclTrap will be sent when the statistic acl is deleted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwDeleteStatisticAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticDirection i 0

variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwStatisticIfIndex

description: The hwAddMirrorAclTrap will be sent when the mirror acl is added.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwAddMirrorAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorDirection i 0

description: Indicates the delivery entry index of an ACL rule for mirroring packets.
It is a delivery record entry index used by software, which is meaningless to users.
The index is used in hwMirrorTable to search the delivery entries fast.
Range: 0-2999
In the create operation, the device automatically allocates a delivery entry index.
There is a suggestion that users can always input 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorAclIndex

description: Indicates the port or the slot index when the device delivers an ACL rule for mirroring packets to a specified port.
The index uniquely identifies a port or a slot. The value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
If the configuration based on a slot, the bits map is shown as follows:
| 31-25 bits | 24-19 bits | 18-13 bits | 12-6 bits | 5-0 bits is reserved |
| indicate iftype | indicate frame ID | indicate slot ID | indicate port ID | |
| the value of iftype | frame ID | slot ID | the value of port ID | the reserved value |
| is always 0x68 | | | is always 0 | is always 0 |
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorIfIndex

description: Indicates the direction where an ACL rule for mirroring packets takes
effect when the device delivers an ACL rule to a specified port or a specified slot.
Options:
1. invalid(0) -indicates an invalid parameter.
2. inbound(1) -indicates the inbound direction of a port or slot.
It is used for mirroring the packets that are received on a specified port or a specified slot.
3. outbound(2) -indicates the outbound direction of a port or slot.
It is used for mirroring the packets that are transmitted on a specified port or a specified slot.
variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorDirection

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwDeleteMirrorAclTrap HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorAclIndex i 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorIfIndex u 0 HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorDirection i 0

variables.name: HUAWEI-QOS-MIB::hwMirrorIfIndex
